definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.chinese: 我想到了急性戒斷綜合症。

sentences.english: Varenicline is a prescription medication that can help reduce cravings for tobacco and control nicotine withdrawal symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 伐尼克蘭是一種減輕煙草慾望和戒斷症狀的處方製劑。

sentences.english: In many ways, separation appears to resemble drug withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 分離後的表現在許多方面都類似於毒品戒斷。

sentences.english: But as you grow in faith, he will wean you of these dependencies.
sentences.chinese: 但是當你在信心中成長，他要你戒斷這些依賴。

definition: lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
ājñā or ajna, the brow or third eye chakra 查克拉, residing in the forehead/also written 眉間輪|眉间轮[mei2 jian1 lun2]
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
